meanings.definition: To move with force or speed, as in wind blowing through the trees.
meanings.sent1: The strong wind can blow away the leaves.
meanings.sent2: I blow bubbles with my bubble wand.
meanings.sent3: The wind can blow so hard, it makes my hat fly off!
meanings.sent4: Her determination to win the race will blow away the competition.
meanings.sent5: The hurricane will blow through the town, causing chaos.

meanings.definition: To create a burst of air or wind, as in blowing out candles.
meanings.sent1: I blow out the candles on my birthday cake.
meanings.sent2: The wind can blow softly through the open window.
meanings.sent3: If you blow too hard, you might blow out the entire cake!
meanings.sent4: The strong gust of wind can blow out the flame in an instant.
meanings.sent5: She had to blow out the match before it burned her fingers.

meanings.definition: To cause to explode or burst, as in blowing up a balloon.
meanings.sent1: I blow up balloons for the party decorations.
meanings.sent2: The balloon will blow up if you keep adding air.
meanings.sent3: He tried to blow up the balloon, but it popped in his face!
meanings.sent4: The scientist will blow up the balloon to demonstrate the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The kids love to blow up balloons and play with them.

meanings.definition: To spend money recklessly or wastefully, as in blowing all your savings on a vacation.
meanings.sent1: She will blow all her money on shopping sprees.
meanings.sent2: If you blow your savings, you might regret it later.
meanings.sent3: He tends to blow his paycheck on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: The lottery winner blew all the money on luxury cars.
meanings.sent5: Don't blow your entire budget on unnecessary things.

meanings.definition: A sudden, hard stroke with a hand, weapon, or hard object, as in delivering a blow to the head.
meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a powerful blow to his opponent.
meanings.sent2: A blow to the head can cause serious injury.
meanings.sent3: He felt the blow to his pride when he lost the game.
meanings.sent4: The final blow came when he lost his job.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected blow left him stunned and confused.
